author: admin3
title: Papa Francisco pede â€˜fidelidade Ã  democraciaâ€™ - ISTOÃ‰ Independente
text:
VATICANO, 1 JUN (ANSA) â€“ Em uma audiÃªncia neste sÃ¡bado (1Âº) com 6 mil representantes das AssociaÃ§Ãµes CristÃ£s de Trabalhadores Italianos (ACLI) por ocasiÃ£o do 80Â° aniversÃ¡rio de fundaÃ§Ã£o, o papa Francisco pediu â€œfidelidade Ã  democraciaâ€.
â€œHoje precisamos muito dela. Uma sociedade democrÃ¡tica Ã© aquela em que realmente hÃ¡ lugar para todos, na realidade dos fatos e nÃ£o apenas em declaraÃ§Ãµes e no papelâ€, disse Francisco.
â€œÃ‰ importante o Ã¡rduo trabalho que vocÃªs fazem, especialmente para apoiar aqueles que correm o risco de serem marginalizados: os jovens, para os quais sÃ£o destinadas iniciativas de formaÃ§Ã£o profissional; as mulheres, que frequentemente continuam a sofrer formas de discriminaÃ§Ã£o e desigualdade.â€ â€œOs trabalhadores mais vulnerÃ¡veis e os migrantes, que encontram alguÃ©m capaz de ajudÃ¡-los a obter o respeito de seus direitos; e finalmente os idosos e aposentados, que com muita facilidade sÃ£o â€˜descartadosâ€™ pela sociedade. E isso Ã© uma injustiÃ§aâ€, elencou o pontÃ­fice.
â€œA estas pessoas vocÃªs prestam um serviÃ§o importante, que nÃ£o deve apenas se limitar Ã  assistÃªncia, mas promover a dignidade de cada pessoa e a possibilidade de que cada um possa colocar em campo seus recursos e sua contribuiÃ§Ã£oâ€, concluiu Francisco. (ANSA).

author: Peter086
title: #66 Rabino sionista expone la mentalidad supremacista sionista autoproclamÃ¡ndose como los "elegidos de dios" y admitiendo sentirse superior a los no-judios
text:
Portada
mis comunidades
otras secciones
[#3](c3#c-3) y estÃ¡ escrito, en su libro mÃ¡gico, que todos los no judÃ­os existen para servir a los judÃ­os.
Su libro mÃ¡gico es el bueno, los demÃ¡s libros mÃ¡gicos no.
[#19](c19#c-19) En realidad sÃ­, pero no te alarmes, no hay construcciÃ³n de la identidad etnica de un grupo (y mÃ¡s si se trata de uno generalmente minoritario y perseguido)n sin su dosis de etnocentrismo.
En el caso de los creyentes en yahvÃ© el resto de la humanidad es referida como â€œgoyimâ€, o â€œgentilesâ€ y no tiene connotaciones especialmente positivas.
[#9](c9#c-9) [#19](c19#c-19) "En la TorÃ¡ se afirma claramente que el hombre fue creado con un propÃ³sito concreto: emular la justicia Divina sobre la Tierra. En un principio, toda la humanidad fue elegida para esta tarea. Sin embargo, los primeros hombres no dieron cumplimiento a esta, misiÃ³n y permitieron que la- corrupciÃ³n y la violencia predominaran sobre la justicia y la bondad. Por ese motivo, Dios determinÃ³ que se produjera el Gran Diluvio (Mabul) a fin de eliminar a los malvados. En lo sucesivo el castigo por incumplimiento se llevarÃ­a a cabo a nivel nacional y no universal. Por esa razÃ³n Dios eligiÃ³ a una naciÃ³n en particular para que cumpliera esta misiÃ³n. El Pueblo Elegido seria una naciÃ³n modelo de Dios sobre la Tierra y demostrarÃ­a al resto de la humanidad cÃ³mo comportarse. Esta naciÃ³n era la judÃ­a."
https://www.tora.org.ar/pueblo-elegido-y-su-mision/
Si eso no es considerar a un pueblo por encima del resto, da lugar a suficientes malas interpretaciones como para llamarles supemacistas.
No hay religiÃ³n buena, no hay fanÃ¡tico respetable.
[#51](c51#c-51) QuÃ© curioso que un diÃ³s omni-de-todo ande con fallos de producciÃ³n (los prototipos) y culpe de ello a sus creaciones.
DiÃ³s: te voy a hacer libre... y te voy a colocar aquÃ­ el fruto del pecado. No lo toques, eh?
El Diablo, tambiÃ©n creado por DiÃ³s, pero SIN que DiÃ³s se percate, dice: no seais pipas, esto mola.
DiÃ³s: Malos! Me habeis desobedecido. Hala.... a la mierda. Pero es vuestra culpa, eh? Que quede claro. Y si os poneis cabezotas, mando a Abogados Cristianos a que se querellen.
[#3](c3#c-3) TÃ­pico de fanatismos y sectas cuando se hace una barrera entre los que estÃ¡n dentro y los que estÃ¡n fuera. Cuando la religiÃ³n no respeta otras formas de ver el mundo es cuando empiezan los fanatismos y las hostias. Si no se acepta la diversidad de credos, apaga y vÃ¡monos porque lo que viene luego no es agradable para nadie.
Luego empezarÃ¡n con sus Frentes Populares de Judea y acabarÃ¡n a hostia limpia entre ellos, porque alguien que necesita y busca enemigos para elevar su moral y sus creencias son un saco de hostias en potencia. Alguien que piense asÃ­, tiene todas las papeletas para recibir hostias a cascoporro y es lo que van buscando. Quien anda con fuego acaba quemÃ¡ndose.
[#2](c2#c-2) Un mes.. da un mes, al resto del planeta - sin eeuu... iban a ver los "elegidos" que opinan de aquello del "pueblo elegido"...
[#9](c9#c-9) Creo que el problema es que eso lo dice la religiÃ³n de los judÃ­os, que son descendientes de no sÃ© quÃ© tribu elegida por un dios.
Y habrÃ¡ judÃ­os que se tomen el judaismo como pertenencia a un grupo y lo reinterpretan y lo ponen al servicio de su vida (igual que hay cristianos que no apedrean a su hija si se casa sin el permiso de su padre). Pero el judaismo tiene una base de supremacismo muy mala de esquivar.
Pues para ser el pueblo elegido:
- menuda mierda territorio les ha dado, a mÃ­ que me den algo que no sea un puto desierto: Francia, El norte de EspaÃ±a, Italia, las Seychelles, las mismas orillas del Nilo, Mesopotamia. Zonas fÃ©rtiles.
- Salvo los Ãºltimos 70 aÃ±os les han dado mÃ¡s que a una estera.
AsÃ­ que menudo dios cutre.
[#11](c11#c-11) Eso es: si su dios los hubiera elegido y les tuviera cariÃ±o bien pudo haberles dao cuerpo de senegalÃ©s...
[#11](c11#c-11) Un amigo ingeniero agrÃ³nomo me contÃ³ que aquella zona en tiempos bÃ­blicos fue un vergel, pero empezaron a regar los cultivos con agua de mar y se lo cargaron. No son muy listos los â€œelegidosâ€.
[#39](c39#c-39) igual no tenÃ­a pilas el GPS porque se hace andando en 'algo menos' de 40 aÃ±os
https://www.google.com/maps/dir/Suez,+Gobernaci%C3%B3n+de+Suez,+Egipto/israel/@29.6717022,33.3954656,504278m/data=!3m1!1e3!4m16!4m15!1m5!1m1!1s0x1456257838ae4111:0x1f0a056a97ea1bc0!2m2!1d32.5498069!2d29.9668343!1m5!1m1!1s0x1500492432a7c98b:0x6a6b422013352cba!2m2!1d34.851612!2d31.046051!2m1!3b1!3e2?entry=ttu
[#23](c23#c-23) No sÃ© salvaron los que no quisieron realizar la AliÃ¡ (que empezÃ³ en 1840 https://es.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ali%C3%A1 ) y a esos que no se salvaron los llamaron los sacrificados o holocausto https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Holocausto_(sacrificio)
[#57](c57#c-57) SerÃ¡ que entonces todos somos africanos..
Siempre ha sido asÃ­. Si tu padre es judÃ­o pero tÃº madre no, no eres judÃ­o.
Otra cosa son los judÃ­os askenazis que no tienen origen semita pero ellos creen que sÃ­ cuando en verdad, tienen origen centroeuropeo (son la mayorÃ­a de la poblaciÃ³n actual de Israel) . O los judÃ­os etÃ­opes (betas) que mencionabas antes y que al ser negros, los tienen como judÃ­os de segunda.
Si Dios existiera harÃ­a un fisting con su culo y les enviarÃ­a al puto infierno por toda la eternidad.
Es supremacista (pueblo elegido, el resto estÃ¡ para servir) y elitista (no buscan crear nuevos adeptos como en el cristianismo o islamismo o naces judÃ­o o no eres judÃ­o)
Sorpreson en Las Gaunas. A poco que se lea la biblia ya se sabe de que palo van.
Pero no les digas que es un plagio de la leyenda de Gilgamesh, el primer corta y pega de la historia.
Esto lo dicen los lideres religiosos judios y la mayoria de ellos lo aceptan como algo natural y te lo repiten con otras palabras menos extremas pero que vienen a ser lo mismo
Pues al final hablando asÃ­ hasta hacen buenos a los nazis, igual estaban engaÃ±ados con esta gente...

author: Crisis24
title: US: Large waves and coastal flooding likely to impact parts of West Coast and Hawaii through Dec. 31 | Crisis24
text: 28 Dec 2023 | 09:31 PM UTC US: Large waves and coastal flooding likely to impact parts of West Coast and Hawaii through Dec. 31 Large waves, coastal flooding likely to impact parts of West Coast of contiguous US and Hawaii through Dec. 31; officials order evacuations. Large waves and coastal flooding are forecast to impact parts of the West Coast of the contiguous US and Hawaii through at least Dec. 31. Coastal flooding had already been reported in some areas along the California coast as of Dec. 28, and authorities accordingly called on residents to evacuate some coastal areas in Marin County and Santa Cruz County. In Marin County, officials ordered residents in the Stinson Beach area to evacuate, including those in Calles Pinos, Pradero, Sierra, Onda Resaca, Ribera, and Embarcadero, as well as parts of Calle del Arroyo. In Santa Cruz County, authorities issued evacuation warnings for Capitola Village, the Pajaro Dunes area, and coastal areas near Seacliff State Beach. The coastal flooding has also prompted officials to close some roads in affected areas, including in Santa Cruz County and Monterey County. Transport disruptions are likely in areas that are subject to road closures. Coastal flooding may impact other communities along the West Coast and in Hawaii over the coming days and prompt local authorities to issue additional evacuation orders and road closures. As of around 13:15 PST Dec. 28, the US National Weather Service had issued the following coastal flood and high surf warnings and advisories for the West Coast of the contiguous US and Hawaii: California Coastal Flood Warning: Coastal North Bay, including Point Reyes National Seashore; Northern Monterey Bay; San Francisco; San Francisco Peninsula coast; Southern Monterey Bay; Big Sur coast; San Luis Obispo County beaches; Santa Barbara County Central Coast beaches; Ventura County beaches Coastal Flood Advisory: Catalina and Santa Barbara islands; Los Angeles County beaches; Malibu coast; Santa Barbara County southeastern and southwestern coasts; San Diego County coastal areas; Orange County coastal areas High Surf Warning: Coastal Del Norte County; Mendocino County coast; southwestern and northern Humboldt County coasts; coastal North Bay, including Point Reyes National Seashore; northern Monterey Bay; San Francisco; San Francisco Peninsula coast; southern Monterey Bay; Big Sur coast; San Luis Obispo County beaches; Santa Barbara County Central Coast beaches; Ventura County beaches; San Diego County coastal areas High Surf Advisory: Catalina and Santa Barbara islands; Los Angeles County beaches; Malibu coast; Santa Barbara County southeastern and southwestern coasts; Orange County coastal areas Hawaii High Surf Warning: Kauai North; Maui Central Valley North; Maui Windward West; Molokai North; Molokai West; Molokai Windward; Niihau; Oahu North Shore; Waianae Coast; Windward Haleakala Oregon High Surf Warning: Curry County coast; south-central Oregon coast High Surf Advisory: Central Oregon coast; north Oregon coast Washington High Surf Advisory: Central Coast; North Coast; south Washington coast Authorities may extend, rescind, or otherwise modify the weather warnings and advisories over the coming days. Flooding is particularly likely in low-lying communities in coastal areas and coastal communities with easily overwhelmed drainage systems. Disruptions to electricity, water supply, and telecommunications services are possible where significant flooding impacts utility networks. Floodwaters and debris flows may render additional bridges, rail networks, or roadways impassable, impacting overland travel in and around affected areas. Ponding on road surfaces could cause hazardous driving conditions on regional highways. Authorities could temporarily close further low-lying routes that become inundated by floodwaters. Flooding could block regional rail lines; freight and passenger train delays and cancellations are likely in areas that experience track inundation. Flight disruptions, including delays and cancellations, may impact airports in coastal areas that experience flooding. Localized business disruptions may occur in low-lying areas; some businesses might not operate at full capacity because of flood damage to facilities, evacuations, or some employees' inability to reach work sites. Monitor local media for weather-related updates and advisories. Confirm all transport reservations and business arrangements before travel. Seek updated information on road conditions before driving or routing shipments through areas where flooding is forecast; plan for possible supply chain disruptions in affected areas. Do not attempt to navigate flooded roadways. Charge battery-powered devices in the case of prolonged electricity outages.

author: Via Bethune-Cookman University Athletics
title: Katie Robinson Wins SWAC Golfer of the Week
text:
Katie Robinson Wins SWAC Golfer of the Week
BIRMINGHAM, Ala. â€“
Bethune-Cookman senior Katie Robinson has been named Southwestern Athletic Conference (SWAC) Women's Golfer of the Week for the period of March 19-24, announced Wednesday afternoon by the league office from its headquarters in Birmingham, Alabama. Most recently, Robinson, a senior from American Canyon, California, finished tied for 25th at the inaugural Hammock Beach Invitational hosted by Purdue Fort Wayne at Hammock Beach Golf Resort & Spa in Palm Beach, Florida. The reigning SWAC Individual Champion fired an opening round 4-over 76 in the opening round of the Hammock Beach Invitational, leading all B-CU scorers on the day....
Read more at
 Bethune-Cookman University Athletics

author: Stanford Medicine Children's Health and Lucile Packard Children's Hospital Stanford
title: How a Social Media Post Led a Teen to Find a 'Kidney Buddy' for Life
text:
PALO ALTO, Calif. Sarah Best was scrolling on Instagram while at home in Sacramento when she came across a stranger's story. It was about a teen who needed a kidney.
"Being O negative, I give a lot of blood, but I always had the thought of wanting to do something more," Sarah said. "When I saw that post, it just felt like it was that time."
Continue Reading
Jaxon Shaneyfelt meets his living kidney donor, Sarah Best, at a follow-up appointment.
The story described a 14-year-old named Jaxon Shaneyfelt from Turlock, California , who got unexpected news that he had kidney failure.
Sarah called the number on the post, which led her to the transplant coordinators at Stanford Medicine Children's Health to begin the living donor screening process. In November 2023 , she was approved to donate.
Jaxon was less than six months from requiring dialysis, said Thomas Pham , MD , pediatric kidney transplant surgical director at Stanford Children's. "Sarah helped him immensely because he didn't need to go on dialysis. That will help with his long-term outcomes. She's also saving another life because it's making an organ available for someone else on the transplant list. With just one act of goodwill, the impact overall is immeasurable."
Before his diagnosis more than a year ago, Jaxon felt like nothing was wrong.
"He was living a normal life," said Micah Shaneyfelt , his mom. "In December 2022 , I noticed that Jaxon was extremely fatigued. After taking him to two different doctors, he continued to get worseâ€”we drove him immediately from our home in Turlock to Lucile Packard Children's Hospital Stanford. They performed scans, multiple tests, and saved his life."
Jaxon had orbital cellulitis, or an infection around his eye. As a part of the check-up, he got lab work and an ultrasound. When those results showed abnormal kidney function, Ruby Patel , MD , pediatric nephrologist at Stanford Children's, sent for a genetic test.
Jaxon was diagnosed with nephronophthisis, a genetic disorder of the kidneys. Children who have this disease need a kidney transplant by the time they're teenagers, as it eventually leads to kidney failure.
"He went from thinking everything was fine to now being told he needed a transplant within a year," Dr. Patel said. "That's hard for anybody."
Facing the news head-on
After his diagnosis, Jaxon and his family met Jennifer Tanaka, RN , BSN, CCTC, his transplant coordinator, for an evaluation appointment to prepare for when he would get sick enough to need a transplant.
"I work with a lot of potential recipients, and sometimes it can be hard for them to reach out and ask for help," Tanaka said. "But, I always tell them, you never know what's out there unless you ask, because there are people that truly do care."
That's exactly what the Shaneyfelts did.
"As soon as we got Jaxon's juvenile nephronophthisis diagnosis, I started sharing his story immediately, since I could not be his donor," Micah said. "I knew it could take some time to find a match, so I needed to get the word out every way I could. We're blessed to live in a time where we have Facebook, Instagram, and all of the other social media platforms."
In June 2023 , Jaxon did get sicker. He was more tired at school. He had to visit Stanford Children's more frequently because his lab results were not great. Jaxon needed a transplant soon. A few months later, he received a fateful call that somebody wanted to donate their kidney to him.
Kidney buddies for life
On Dec. 19, 2023 , Sarah drove from Sacramento to Stanford Medicine . The next day, both Sarah and Jaxon had their surgeries.
"Sarah is truly the definition of altruism," said Gerri James, RN , BSN, CCTC, kidney transplant program manager. "It's a big deal donating to somebody you don't know, and she said, 'As long as I'm home with my family for Christmas, I'll be fine.' It's amazing. That's the best gift Jaxon will ever get."
Jaxon then received another gift. Not all recipients get to meet their donor, and not all living donors meet the patient they helped. But these two had the opportunity at a clinic follow-up.
"The Shaneyfelts are just so sweet," Sarah recalled. "They had no idea who I was, but when I walked in the room, it almost felt like friends you've always had. As we started talking, all these connections started forming. It just feels good that you can help someone live, but there are emotional days. I hope this kidney gives him a long time of healthy living because he's a 14-year-old boy. He should be out having fun."
Jaxon and his family presented Sarah with a kidney plushie they signed with a special message.
"The kindness Sarah's given us just makes me speechless," Jaxon said. "Seeing the person who saved my life made me feel the same way. I want to say thank you again and again to my kidney buddy."
Jaxon is back in school and looking forward to playing basketball again. While getting back to daily life is important, he is also looking forward to the many more meetups he'll have with his kidney buddy, including teasing Sarah's husband about being a Dodgers fan.
"When things started to feel a little discouraging, someone was placed in our lives to lift us up and encourage Jaxonâ€”whether that was his care team, the Turlock community, or his angel on earth, Sarah," Micah said. "Words will never be able to express our appreciation. We are hoping that someday, there will be no wait list, but an abundant list of living donors to give the same gift of life."
The team at Lucile Packard Children's Hospital Stanford has performed more pediatric kidney transplants than any other U.S. center . Learn more about the pediatric kidney transplant and how to become a living donor >
Contact: Katie Chen [email protected]
SOURCE Stanford Medicine Children's Health and Lucile Packard Children's Hospital Stanford

author: Jordi Boggiano
title: benjaminhaeberli/php-skeleton
text: âœ¨ A modern PHP skeleton that includes CI/CD, PHPStan, Pest & more. Maintainers Details github.com/benjaminhaeberli/php-skeleton Fund package maintenance! benjaminhaeberli [Installs](/packages/benjaminhaeberli/php-skeleton/stats): 4 [Dependents](/packages/benjaminhaeberli/php-skeleton/dependents?order_by=downloads): 0 [Suggesters](/packages/benjaminhaeberli/php-skeleton/suggesters): 0 [Security](/packages/benjaminhaeberli/php-skeleton/advisories): 0 Stars: 0 Watchers: 1 Forks: 0 Open Issues: 0 Requires - php: ^8.3.0 Requires (Dev) [laravel/pint](/packages/laravel/pint): ^1.15.1 [nunomaduro/phpinsights](/packages/nunomaduro/phpinsights): ^2.11 [pestphp/pest](/packages/pestphp/pest): ^2.34.7 [pestphp/pest-plugin-type-coverage](/packages/pestphp/pest-plugin-type-coverage): ^2.8.1 [phpstan/phpstan](/packages/phpstan/phpstan): ^1.10.66 [rector/rector](/packages/rector/rector): ^1.0.4 [spatie/ray](/packages/spatie/ray): ^1.41.1 [symfony/var-dumper](/packages/symfony/var-dumper): ^6.4.0|^7.0.6 README Getting started ðŸ”Ž Requirements - PHP 8.3+ Installation You can create a new repository on GitHub or download the ZIP of the latest release. You can also install it using composer : composer create-project benjaminhaeberli/php-skeleton --prefer-source YourApp Then, install composer packages : composer install Commands âŒ¨ï¸ More details in [composer.json] Common ðŸ§¹ Keep a modern codebase with Pint ( see default config) composer pint âš—ï¸ Run static analysis using PHPStan composer phpstan âœ… Run unit tests using PEST composer pest ðŸš€ Run the entire test suite composer test ðŸ§° Validate composer.json and update dependencies composer core:update ðŸ“ˆ Expose code coverage using https://pestphp.com/docs/test-coverage (require XDEBUG in coverage mode) composer pest:coverage Code quality & refactoring ðŸ’Ž Measure the code quality with PHPInsights (see config\insights.php) composer phpinsights âœ… Run refactors using Rector composer rector PHP skeleton is maintained by Benjamin Haeberli under the MIT license.

author: Annemarie GÃ¶bbel
title: Peinlich: TV-Kamera filmt Chris O'Neill wÃ¤hrend Victoria-Konzert am Handy
text:
Peinlich: TV-Kamera filmt Chris Oâ€™Neill wÃ¤hrend Victoria-Konzert am Handy
Chris Oâ€™Neill sorgte beim Victoriakonzert fÃ¼r einen unglÃ¼cklichen Moment, als er wÃ¤hrend der Live-Ãœbertragung sein Smartphone zÃ¼ckte.
Ã–land/Borgholm â€“ Chris Oâ€™Neill (51), der Ehemann von Prinzessin Madeleine (43), ist normalerweise fÃ¼r seine geschÃ¤ftliche ProfessionalitÃ¤t bekannt. Doch beim diesjÃ¤hrigen â€žVictoriakonsertâ€œ zu Ehren von Kronprinzessin Victoria (48) unterlief ihm ein Fehltritt, den die Kameras des schwedischen Fernsehens SVT einfingen.
Chris Oâ€™Neill mit Prinzessin Madeleine beim Geburtstag von Kronprinzessin Victoria
Der GeschÃ¤ftsmann saÃŸ mit der KÃ¶nigsfamilie in der ersten Reihe, denn er ist ja mit Prinzessin Madeleine verheiratet. WÃ¤hrend des Auftritts von SÃ¤nger Peter JÃ¶back (54) erwischten ihn allerdings die TV-Kameras am Handy. Das berichtet das schwedische Magazin Svensk Damtidning und zeigt Bilder der Szene.
Mehr News aus der Welt der Unterhaltung gibt es in unserer neuen Merkur.de-App. Weitere Informationen zur App gibt es hier. Alternativ bietet auch unser neuer Whatsapp-Kanal beste Unterhaltung.
Das jÃ¤hrliche Victoriakonzert am 14. Juli ist traditionell einer der HÃ¶hepunkte im schwedischen KÃ¶nigskalender. Die gesamte KÃ¶nigsfamilie bis auf Prinzessin Sofia (40) war anwesend, um Kronprinzessin Victoria zu feiern â€“ eigentlich ein schÃ¶nes Bild der Einigkeit. Prinzessin Madeleines Familie ist nach Jahren in Florida im Sommer 2024 wieder nach Schweden gezogen. Doch der dreifache Vater kann offenbar nicht von seinem Handy lassen. Das dÃ¼rfte besonders KÃ¶nigin Silvia (81) gestÃ¶rt haben. Sie sprach sich bereits fÃ¼r ein Selfie-Verbot aus.
Beim Geburtstag von Kronprinzessin Victoria: Schwager Chris Oâ€™Neill war kurz abgelenkt
Auch Fotos des schwedischen Entertainment-Portals NÃ¶jeslivet zeigen, wie abgelenkt Madeleines Ehemann war. Immerhin bemerkte Oâ€™Neill die TV-Kamera und steckte das Handy hastig zurÃ¼ck in die Jackentasche. Es mag dringend gewesen sein â€“ trotzdem gehÃ¶rt es sich nicht, das Handy wÃ¤hrend eines Konzerts zu nutzen. Schon gar nicht, wenn man Mitglied der Familie ist, fÃ¼r die das Konzert veranstaltet wird.
AuÃŸerdem haben Chris Oâ€™Neill und Prinzessin Madeleine eine sehr persÃ¶nliche Verbindung zu SÃ¤nger Peter JÃ¶back. Auf Madeleines Wunsch sang er nÃ¤mlich bei ihrer Hochzeit am 8. Juni 2013 in der Stockholmer Schlosskirche den Hit â€žThe First Time Ever I Saw Your Faceâ€œ des verstorbenen Singer-Songwriters Ewan MacColl (74, â€  1989).
Der kleine Zwischenfall stÃ¶rte die festliche Stimmung zum GlÃ¼ck nicht weiter. Trotzdem wirft er kein gutes Licht auf die KÃ¶nigsfamilie. Schade, denn Kronprinzessin Victoria strahlte an ihrem Geburtstag und die Familie genoss sichtlich das Konzert mit Moderatorin Yvette Hermundstad (53). Verwendete Quellen: Svensk Dam, NÃ¶jeslivet, YouTube
